snippet: Critics say the allocation of $507 million in special funds in the budget for the Army Corps of Engineers could be a way to direct money to pet projects.
abstract: New budget for the Army Corps Engineers includes $507 million in special funds for side projects; critics contend that such special funds are merely a new Congressional method for allocating money to pet projects in the wake of a moratorium on legislative earmarks.
lead_paragraph: Critics say the allocation of $507 million in special funds in the budget for the Army Corps of Engineers could be a way to direct money to pet projects.

headline.seo: Congress Appears to Be Trying to Get Around Earmark Ban
headline.main: Congress Appears to Be Trying to Get Around Earmark Ban
headline.print_headline: Special Funds in Budget Called New Earmarks
